text:
I have a hubdb set up with child tables. The url is like so:
`<https://www.website.com/main-dynamic-page/child-table-slug/final-item-slug>`
In HubSpot’s analytics code, I am seeing an array with:
`"setCanonicalUrl", "https:\/\/www.website.com\/main-dynamic-page\/final-item-slug"`
the part of the page’s url with `child-table-slug` is missing. Why is that? A _screaming frog report_ of those pages says they are not indexable because of that
Can you send me the example page?
Actually I have an example page
Should be fixed on your page

Just starting out: I'm trying to create my first dynamic page. I have a HubDB table created with 15 rows. I have created and tested my Hubl template and that works as expected per the documentation. I am now at the part of creating a dynamic page. The documentation drops off here and I don't understand how the Hubl template and the Dynamic page interact. Under advanced settings, I have selected my HubDB table. Past that, I'm not sure how to proceed. Any help is much appreciated. Thanks!
this is a good chance to plug <@U3PKJ8EQL> new course: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1550780133011300>
I think the section on hubdb and dynamic pages is pretty well laid out in the tutorial.  I highly suggest watching it

<@UFAUZE1QD> This video specifically: <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/learning-center/tracks/34/354/1923> should walk you through the exact steps. And if it's in any way unclear after watching that I would _love_ it if you could DM me and offer any feedback on where it could be clearer.
Excellent, thanks! I will check it out.
